This is an Atom formatted XML site feed. It is intended to be viewed in a Newsreader. Alternatively you can view the HTML archives at https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/cgi-bin/webadmin?A0=BEL-NET.
LISTSERV Web Interface 2.4.1 2015-02-23T11:03:22Z Julian Sidoli del Ceno 2015-02-23T10:31:52+00:00 2015-02-23T10:31:52+00:00 Housing Law Conference https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BEL-NET;41442af8.1502 Hi Paul<br><br>Could you announce via mailing list etc the following please:<br><br>The Housing Law Research Network and the Housing Law Working Group, European Network of Housing Research (ENHR) invite submissions on any field of housing law broadly conceived (including housing rights, nuisance, neighbour law, tenure, dispute resolution and litigation, anti-social behaviour etc) for the annual conference to be held in Lisbon, Portugal 30th June - 3rd July. Full details can be found at www.enhr2015.com<http://www.enhr2015.com> [...] Chynoweth Paul 2015-01-19T10:22:34+00:00 2015-01-19T10:22:34+00:00 Deadline for Papers - COBRA 2015 - Sydney, Australia - Wednesday 4th February 2015 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BEL-NET;184218d7.1501 COBRA Conference 2015 - Sydney, Australia, July 2015<http://www.lawlectures.co.uk/w113/cobra2015.htm><br>CIB W113 - RICS Legal Research Symposium<http://www.lawlectures.co.uk/w113/cobra2015.htm><br><br>[cid:image003.jpg@01CF9607.D648B3A0]<http://www.lawlectures.co.uk/w113/cobra2015.htm><br><br>DEADLINE FOR PAPERS - 4th FEBRUARY 2015<http://www.lawlectures.co.uk/w113/cobra2015.htm><br><br>A reminder - for those who have already had abstracts accepted - that the deadline for submission of papers for the COBRA 2015 conference is Wednesday 4th February 2015. I am advised that no extensions will be allowed beyond this date. [...] Thompson, Chris 2014-10-29T12:40:55+00:00 2014-10-29T12:40:55+00:00 NEW Oxford DPhil (PhD) in Sustainable Urban Development with scholarship available https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BEL-NET;161fd5.1410 Dear colleagues,<br><br>*with apologies for cross posting*<br><br>The University of Oxford is delighted to announce the launch of a new part-time DPhil (PhD) in Sustainable Urban Development<http://www.conted.ox.ac.uk/DSUD>. We would be grateful if list members would share this information with students, colleagues and associates for whom it will be of interest.<br><br>The DPhil is a research doctorate, which culminates in a substantive academic thesis and performance in a viva voce. Successful candidates will have a very strong academic record and will show great aptitude through their academic proposal. Throughout their period of study, candidates will join a wider international community of [...] Melissa Phillips 2014-10-09T10:17:04+01:00 2014-10-09T10:17:04+01:00 Law Around The World - Free to Read https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BEL-NET;7f53120d.1410 Dear colleagues,<br><br>I am delighted to share with you a free article and eBook collection on Law around the world. We have selected leading papers and grouped these into regions, such as Africa, the Americas, Asia, Europe and Oceania, to make your research into Law and legal practices around the globe easier and faster. [...] Julian Sidoli del Ceno 2014-09-10T16:04:19+00:00 2014-09-10T16:04:19+00:00 Fully funded PhD opportunity https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BEL-NET;d3bda309.1409 Housing and Dispute Resolution: social wellbeing and bottom up forms of community engagement<br><br>Full fee waiver plus an annual stipend of \ufffd\ufffd13,863. Deadline 24th October 2014<br><br>The housing crisis across much of Europe, and indeed other parts of the world, shows no sign of abating. The issue is particularly pressing in high-density urban settlements where the further problems of low income, immigration and lack of community engagement are often found. The solution is often deemed simply to be more housing, but this is often not achievable especially in the short term. There are further issues that are intimately linked to [...] Graham Cairns 2014-09-10T15:25:54+01:00 2014-09-10T15:25:54+01:00 Housing \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd A Critical Perspective_Interdisciplinary Call https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BEL-NET;f66c32fe.1409 Conference: 08-09 April 2015<br><br>Together with the Sociology Department of Liverpool University and the Architecture Department of Liverpool John Moores University, Architecture_MPS is organising a two day interdisciplinary conference on the theme of affordable housing provision. Forming part of a broader program of international events, Housing \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Critical Futures, it is open to activists, artists and academics of all disciplines. It is set in the UK but seeks to link with global issues. Once again, this is being organised by CIB Working Commission (W113) on Law and Dispute Resolution and supported by the International Journal of Law in the Built Environment. [...] Professor Aymen Masadeh 2014-05-20T18:28:05+04:00 2014-05-20T18:28:05+04:00 Teaching opportunity: announcement of a construction law vacancy at the British University in Dubai https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BEL-NET;d912a2f0.1405 Dear colleagues<br><br>I would like to draw your attention to the construction law vacancy at the<br>British University in Dubai. To apply or to know more about this vacancy,<br>please follow this link http://www.buid.ac.ae/buid/page.php?id=1212<br><http://www.buid.ac.ae/buid/page.php?id=1212&pageId=1188> &pageId=1188 .<br>Please do not hesitate to contact me if you require further information.<br><br>Best regards<br><br>Aymen Chynoweth Paul 2014-05-19T13:03:06+00:00 2014-05-19T13:03:06+00:00 Environmental Law Special Issue - Free Access Now Available https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BEL-NET;6bb664d.1405 With apologies for the earlier technical problems, free online access to this special issue (below) is now available at the following URL until 19th June:<br><br>http://www.emeraldinsight.com/journals.htm?issn=1756-1450&volume=6&issue=1<br><br>I am assured that everything is now working but please alert Lucy Houlden at LHoulden@emeraldinsight.com<mailto:LHoulden@emeraldinsight.com> if you continue to experience any difficulties.<br><br>With many thanks<br><br>Paul<br><br>From: Chynoweth Paul<br>Sent: 09 May 2014 10:56<br>To: Chynoweth Paul<br>Subject: Environmental Law Special Issue [...] Jane Ball 2014-05-16T09:16:06+00:00 2014-05-16T09:16:06+00:00 FW: Madrid Workshop - promotion https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BEL-NET;1d68a2c9.1405 I am writing to invite you to participate in an expert workshop in Madrid, Spain on Friday 13 June 2014. The event is designed to bring together approximately 80 experts from across Europe working on issues including housing economics, law, housing rights, homeless services, social housing, financing and foundations, local governments, academics and other groups and individuals. We will facilitate the sharing of promising practices and policies, relevant case law, legal precedents and research and provide an opportunity to share ideas, concepts, and information in an atmosphere that stimulates future collaboration and projects. There will be simultaneous translation into English, [...] Chynoweth Paul 2014-05-09T09:56:17+00:00 2014-05-09T09:56:17+00:00 Environmental Law Special Issue https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BEL-NET;fd3d28d3.1405 Environmental Law Special issue - Editor: Julie Adshead<br><br>[cid:image007.jpg@01CF6B75.4B26BF90]<br><br>I am delighted to announce the publication of a special double issue of the IJLBE dedicated to the subject of Environmental Law. Under the editorship of Julie Adshead the issue contains the following 11 articles:<br><br>* Richard Macrory - Guest editorial: Judges and the government [...]
